snippet: A day after his conviction on embezzlement charges incited protests, Aleksei A. Navalny was released from custody.
abstract: Russian opposition leader Aleksei A Navalny is released from prison pending appeal one day after being sentenced to five years for embezzlement; Navalny's supporters insist that rally by thousands of people forced officials to let him go, while others say his release reflects disagreement and disarray at highest levels of government.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry and Andrew Roth contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A day after his conviction on embezzlement charges incited protests, Aleksei A. Navalny was released from custody.

headline.main: Leading Putin Critic Is Freed Pending Appeal After Protests
headline.print_headline: Putin Critic Free for Now, A Day After His Conviction
